article.headline: Sacred Heart 61, Wagner 50
article.story: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- Kibwe Trim and Jarrid Frye had 18 points each to lead Sacred Heart to a 61-50 victory over Wagner College in a Northeast Conference game Saturday. Trim added ten rebounds for his sixth double-double of the season. Sacred Heart (5-7, 2-1 NEC) took a 7-1 lead with five points from Frye. The score was 24-12 with 5:49 left in the first half after a short jumper from freshman center Liam Potter. The Pioneers led 33-20 at half time. With 13:04 to play in the second half, Wagner (8-4, 1-2 NEC) pulled within three to 37-34 on a pair of free throws by DeEarnest McLemore. A McLemore jumper cut Sacred Heart's lead to 39-38 with 10:08 left. A three-pointer from Seahawk Joey Mudweiler with 4:07 to go cut the Pioneer lead to 50-47. After Trim hit a pair of free throws for Sacred Heart, sophomore James Ulrich buried another three for Wagner to make it 52-50 with 2:55 left. Those were the last points for the Seahawks. Freshman Jamal Smith led Wagner with 14 points, while McLemore finished with ten. Junior center Durell Vinson finished with his own double-double with ten points and a game-high 11 rebounds.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
